@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The Toolbar class is the main part of the toolbar widget.

It can handle added {@link Button}s, {@link CheckBox}es, {@link RadioButton}s
and {@link Separator}s in its {@link #add} method. The {@link #addSpacer} method
adds a spacer at the current toolbar position. This means that the widgets
added after the method call of {@link #addSpacer} are aligned to the right of
the toolbar.

For more details on the documentation of the toolbar widget, take a look at the
documentation of the {@link qx.ui.toolbar}-Package.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Appearance of the widget

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Holds the currently open menu (when the toolbar is used for menus)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether icons, labels, both or none should be shown.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The spacing between every child of the toolbar

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Widget which will be shown if at least one toolbar item is hidden.
Keep in mind to add this widget to the toolbar before you set it as
indicator!

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Enables the overflow handling which automatically removes items.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Map} The map with the preferred width/height and the allowed
minimum and maximum values.
@return.desc:
The map with the preferred width/height and the allowed
minimum and maximum values.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper to show a toolbar item.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.Widget} The widget to show.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper to exclude a toolbar item.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.Widget} The widget to exclude.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Responsible for returning the next item to remove. In It checks the
priorities added by {@link #setRemovePriority}. If all priorized widgets
already excluded, it takes the widget added at last.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.ui.core.Widget|null} The widget which should be removed next.
If null is returned, no widget is available to remove.
@return.desc:
The widget which should be removed next.
If null is returned, no widget is available to remove.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The removal of the toolbar items is priority based. You can change these
priorities with this method. The higher a priority, the earlier it will
be excluded. Remember to use every priority only once! If you want
override an already set priority, use the override parameter.
Keep in mind to only use already added items.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: item {qx.ui.core.Widget} The item to give the priority.
@param.description: The item to give the priority.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: priority {Integer} The priority, higher means removed earlier.
@param.description: The priority, higher means removed earlier.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: override {Boolean} true, if the priority should be overridden.
@param.description: true, if the priority should be overridden.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Add a spacer to the toolbar. The spacer has a flex
value of one and will stretch to the available space.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.ui.core.Spacer} The newly added spacer object. A reference
to the spacer is needed to remove this spacer from the layout.
@return.desc:
The newly added spacer object. A reference
to the spacer is needed to remove this spacer from the layout.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds a separator to the toolbar.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Returns all nested buttons which contains a menu to show. This is mainly
used for keyboard support.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the children list

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{LayoutItem[]} The children array (Arrays are
reference types, please do not modify them in-place)
@return.desc:
The children array (Arrays are
reference types, please do not modify them in-place)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget contains children.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Returns true when the widget has children.
@return.desc: Returns true when the widget has children.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the index position of the given widget if it is a child widget. Otherwise it returns -1. This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {Widget} the widget to query for

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} The index position or -1 when the given widget is no child of this layout.
@return.desc: The index position or -1 when the given widget is no child of this layout.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Adds a new child widget.

The supported keys of the layout options map depend on the layout manager
used to position the widget. The options are documented in the class
documentation of each layout manager {@link qx.ui.layout}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {LayoutItem} the widget to add.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Add a child widget at the specified index

This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers
(e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional
layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid})
ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {LayoutItem} Widget to add

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Integer} Index, at which the widget will be inserted
@param.description: Index, at which the widget will be inserted

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Add a widget before another already inserted widget

This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers
(e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional
layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid})
ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {LayoutItem} Widget to add

@param.name: @param
@param.body: before {LayoutItem} Widget before the new widget will be inserted.
@param.description: Widget before the new widget will be inserted.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Add a widget after another already inserted widget

This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers
(e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional
layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid})
ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {LayoutItem} Widget to add

@param.name: @param
@param.body: after {LayoutItem} Widget, after which the new widget will be inserted
@param.description: Widget, after which the new widget will be inserted

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove the given child widget.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {LayoutItem} the widget to remove

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Remove the widget at the specified index.

This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers
(e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional
layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid})
ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Integer} Index of the widget to remove.
@param.description: Index of the widget to remove.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove all children.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Array} An array of the removed children.
@return.desc: An array of the removed children.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Translate a message
Mark the message for translation.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: messageId {String} message id (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {Object} variable number of arguments applied to the format string
@param.description: variable number of arguments applied to the format string

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String | LocalizedString} The translated message or localized string
@return.desc: The translated message or localized string

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Translate a plural message
Mark the messages for translation.

Depending on the third argument the plural or the singular form is chosen.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: singularMessageId {String} message id of the singular form (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id of the singular form (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: pluralMessageId {String} message id of the plural form (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id of the plural form (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: count {Integer} if greater than 1 the plural form otherwise the singular form is returned.
@param.description: if greater than 1 the plural form otherwise the singular form is returned.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {Object} variable number of arguments applied to the format string
@param.description: variable number of arguments applied to the format string

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String | LocalizedString} The translated message or localized string
@return.desc: The translated message or localized string

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Translate a message with translation hint
Mark the messages for translation.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: hint {String} hint for the translator of the message. Will be included in the .po file.
@param.description: hint for the translator of the message. Will be included in the .po file.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: messageId {String} message id (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {Object} variable number of arguments applied to the format string
@param.description: variable number of arguments applied to the format string

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String | LocalizedString} The translated message or localized string
@return.desc: The translated message or localized string

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Translate a plural message with translation hint
Mark the messages for translation.

Depending on the third argument the plural or the singular form is chosen.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: hint {String} hint for the translator of the message. Will be included in the .po file.
@param.description: hint for the translator of the message. Will be included in the .po file.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: singularMessageId {String} message id of the singular form (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id of the singular form (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: pluralMessageId {String} message id of the plural form (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id of the plural form (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: count {Integer} if greater than 1 the plural form otherwise the singular form is returned.
@param.description: if greater than 1 the plural form otherwise the singular form is returned.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {Object} variable number of arguments applied to the format string
@param.description: variable number of arguments applied to the format string

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String | LocalizedString} The translated message or localized string
@return.desc: The translated message or localized string

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Mark the message for translation but return the original message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: messageId {String} the message ID
